About

I used to be a bookkeeper. I learned to code because I enjoyed my clients’ work more than my own. The programmers I contracted for were doing challenging and intense work. I wanted to do that too, so I studied web development through the online program, Bloc. I love it, and I look forward to learning more about all-things-development. When I’m not cooking up code, I’m cooking something in the kitchen. You can check out my resume here.

Latest Blog Post

27 Jun 2015 . tech . Welcome to { Personal } Jekyll Theme! Comments

Click the view more posts link bellow, to see the currently available post-tutorials to help you get your { Personal } website up and running quicker!

Note that every time you update the site configuration (_config.yml), you will need to cancel the serving (Ctr + C) and serve the website again.

Any contributions, feedback or issues to the repo are more than welcome!
